translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The government received your letter dated the 23rd of this month and is assured by what Your Excellency Captain Félix has reported concerning the enemy's movements.

The government has nothing to add to what it ordered you on the previous day, but expects you to frequently communicate everything that occurs, both regarding your march and that of Colonel Crescêncio, as well as about the enemy's movements. Yesterday, Lieutenant Manuel Antônio was sent with all the foot soldiers and as many horsemen as could be arranged, to the point that only a few men were left to butcher.

If Your Excellency Juca Cipriano, Fialho, and others remained in the rear guard, the government expects prompt communication of this in order to take the appropriate measures.

God keep Your Excellency  
Secretary of War Affairs  
Vacacaí, March 24, 1840  

Most Illustrious Sir Colonel João Antônio da Silveira  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Most Illustrious Sir Colonel João Antônio da Silveira,  
Commander of the Right Division  
Wherever you may be  
From the Ministry of War
